title: First Teaser for 'Five Nights at Freddy's 2' Animatronic Horror Sequel
description: "They're out there, Mike." "Where?!" "Everywhere." Blumhouse & Universal have unveiled the first teaser trailer for horror sequel Five Nights at Freddy's 2, continuing the animatronic terror on the big screen. Ready for more? Arriving in December at the end of this year. Blumhouse’s box-office horror phenomenon Five Nights at Freddy's, the highest-grossing horror movie of 2023, begins a blood-chilling new chapter of animatronic terror. Based on Scott Cawthon’s hit video game series, Five Nights at Freddy's 2 is directed by acclaimed returning filmmaker Emma Tammi. The next one seems to continue right where the last left off, with Josh Hutcherson returning to his lead role. Now being hunted down by the Fozbears. Also starring Matthew Lillard, Elizabeth Lail, Piper Rubio, and all the animatronic monsters. "Welcome back! Are you ready to start the show?" There's a few quick glimpses of some freaky footage in here to get the hype going for a release a full 8 months from now. The bots are all back! Let's hope this one turns out a bit better. Here's the first teaser trailer for Emma Tammi's horror sequel Five Nights at Freddy's 2, from YouTube: Anyone can survive five nights. This time, there will […]
author: Alex Billington
excerpt: "They're out there, Mike." "Where?!" "Everywhere." Blumhouse & Universal have unveiled the first teaser trailer for horror sequel Five Nights at Freddy's 2, continuing the animatronic terror on the big screen. Ready for more? Arriving in December at the end of this year. Blumhouse’s box-office horror phenomenon Five Nights at Freddy's, the highest-grossing horror movie
text: TRAILERS by April 2, 2025Source: YouTube "They're out there, Mike." "Where?!" "Everywhere." Blumhouse & Universal have unveiled the first teaser trailer for horror sequel Five Nights at Freddy's 2, continuing the animatronic terror on the big screen. Ready for more? Arriving in December at the end of this year. Blumhouse’s box-office horror phenomenon Five Nights at Freddy's, the highest-grossing horror movie of 2023, begins a blood-chilling new chapter of animatronic terror. Based on Scott Cawthon’s hit video game series, Five Nights at Freddy's 2 is directed by acclaimed returning filmmaker Emma Tammi. The next one seems to continue right where the last left off, with Josh Hutcherson returning to his lead role. Now being hunted down by the Fozbears. Also starring Matthew Lillard, Elizabeth Lail, Piper Rubio, and all the animatronic monsters. "Welcome back! Are you ready to start the show?" There's a few quick glimpses of some freaky footage in here to get the hype going for a release a full 8 months from now. The bots are all back! Let's hope this one turns out a bit better. Here's the first teaser trailer for Emma Tammi's horror sequel Five Nights at Freddy's 2, from YouTube: Anyone can survive five nights. This time, there will be no second chances. The first film, which opened to a record-shattering $80 million and went on to earn almost $300 million worldwide, followed Mike (Josh Hutcherson), a troubled young man who reluctantly takes a job as a night security guard at an abandoned theme restaurant, called Freddy Fazbear’s Pizzeria, hoping it will help him retain custody of his young sister. That fateful decision instead drags him into the black heart of a supernatural nightmare. And he will never be the same again. Five Nights at Freddy's 2 is directed by the American producer / filmmaker Emma Tammi, director of the film The Wind and the first Five Nights at Freddy's movie, plus the doc Fair Chase and podcast "The Left Right Game". The screenplay is by Scott Cawthon, Seth Cuddeback, Emma Tammi. Produced by Jason Blum and Scott Cawthon. Universal will debut Tammi's Five Nights at Freddy's 2 in theaters nationwide starting on December 5th, 2025 at the end of this year. Who's excited for more? html:
TRAILERS

by
April 2, 2025
Source: YouTube

"They're out there, Mike." "Where?!" "Everywhere." Blumhouse & Universal have unveiled the first teaser trailer for horror sequel Five Nights at Freddy's 2, continuing the animatronic terror on the big screen. Ready for more? Arriving in December at the end of this year. Blumhouse’s box-office horror phenomenon Five Nights at Freddy's, the highest-grossing horror movie of 2023, begins a blood-chilling new chapter of animatronic terror. Based on Scott Cawthon’s hit video game series, Five Nights at Freddy's 2 is directed by acclaimed returning filmmaker Emma Tammi. The next one seems to continue right where the last left off, with Josh Hutcherson returning to his lead role. Now being hunted down by the Fozbears. Also starring Matthew Lillard, Elizabeth Lail, Piper Rubio, and all the animatronic monsters. "Welcome back! Are you ready to start the show?" There's a few quick glimpses of some freaky footage in here to get the hype going for a release a full 8 months from now. The bots are all back! Let's hope this one turns out a bit better.

Here's the first teaser trailer for Emma Tammi's horror sequel Five Nights at Freddy's 2, from YouTube:

Anyone can survive five nights. This time, there will be no second chances. The first film, which opened to a record-shattering $80 million and went on to earn almost $300 million worldwide, followed Mike (Josh Hutcherson), a troubled young man who reluctantly takes a job as a night security guard at an abandoned theme restaurant, called Freddy Fazbear’s Pizzeria, hoping it will help him retain custody of his young sister. That fateful decision instead drags him into the black heart of a supernatural nightmare. And he will never be the same again. Five Nights at Freddy's 2 is directed by the American producer / filmmaker Emma Tammi, director of the film The Wind and the first Five Nights at Freddy's movie, plus the doc Fair Chase and podcast "The Left Right Game". The screenplay is by Scott Cawthon, Seth Cuddeback, Emma Tammi. Produced by Jason Blum and Scott Cawthon. Universal will debut Tammi's Five Nights at Freddy's 2 in theaters nationwide starting on December 5th, 2025 at the end of this year. Who's excited for more?

Find more posts in: Horror, To Watch, Trailer
